title: Biscayne National Park: Public Transportation
body: Explore This Park    Plan Your Visit     Directions & Transportation     Public Transportation              Public Transportation      Homestead's award-winning National Parks Trolley service runs every weekend from late November through April. The trolley departs every Saturday and Sunday from historic downtown Homestead. The trolley travels to Biscayne National Park's Dante Fascell Visitor Center and boardwalk as well as Miami-Dade County's Homestead Bayfront Park where visitors may swim at the atoll beach. It also takes visitors to Everglades National Park's Ernest F. Coe Visitor Center and riders enjoy free entrance into the park to visit the Anhinga Trail.The Homestead National Parks Trolley may be boarded at Losner Park in Homestead at 104 N. Krome Avenue. The trolley connects to bus routes from Miami-Dade County public transportation. There is plenty of free parking adjacent to the trolley stop. Use the following link for more information on the Homestead National Parks Trolley.  Â     Homestead National Parks Trolley in front of the Dante Fascell Visitor Center. NPS Image by Matt Johnson
